and for those of you trying to save.. all you have to do is when the GFWL thing comes up select Create New Profile... then scroll down to USER LOCAL PROFILE... this will create an offline profile and you'll be able to save... 

There ya go..... enjoy!

Alright. This is how you make a offline account for Games For Windows Live. Before you bitch about how it doesn't work maybe you read this twice BEFORE posting.

1. Log out of your GFWL online profile if you have one, or simply hit escape, and GFWL will sign you out of Live but not your profile (if you do this, Windows Live will still track the achievements for this game but never require a product code, if you feel cyber cops are watching you- this won't help). Exit out of the GFWL interface.
2. Hit your "Home" key or whatever key you've set to open GFWL.
3. Click on the "Create New Profile" Button.
4. On the next page scroll the text box down a bit and you will see a "create a local profile" in blue lettering and underlined as well. Click on it.
5. Make profile.

I beat RE 1,2, and 3 within 5-6 hours each this year after downloading them off PSN (granted I never played the Alternate stories) The length of the campaign isn't that big of deal in a market where most games are 6-9 hours in length anyways. Play it on a harder difficulty AND with friends. I could understand people upset with paying 60 dollars for it because it ISN'T worth 60 dollars.

Then again I didn't consider L4D2 worth 60 dollars when is came out either. But, there IS fun to be had when playing on a powerful enough system with your friends. The controls are nowhere near as clunky as people say. I really enjoy the melee move sets that you can learn. Like kicking the feet out from under a guard and sticking your gun to his face is the shit.

If you play on a harder difficulty with friends the game can be really enjoyable and even at moments suspenseful. For example, In one particular moment I was fighting with my friends in a hall and two of them were infected. We didn't have any anti virus spray and we were down to our last bit of health when they turned and killed us. It was a pretty intense moment.

The game isn't supposed to be horror, it's supposed to deliver a fun co-op experience and too a degree it delivers.

7/10 because the game isn't perfect but it can provide some "OHHH SHIIIT" moments while playing with friends.

Don't spend more than 20-30 dollars on this game unless you plan on playing with good friends.
